HowToAcknowledge: If using this dataset, please consider citing our data paper (preprint: https://osf.io/preprints/psyarxiv/vqpnx) and our original work relating to the Social Doors Task (Wyngaarden, J.B., et al., https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.01.17.524305), the Shared Reward Task (Zaff, O., et al., https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.10.19.562908), and/or the Ultimatum/Dictator Game Task (Sazhin, D., et al., https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.10.19.563125).
Name: An fMRI dataset of social and nonsocial reward processing in young adults
ReferencesAndLinks: Sazhin, D., et al., The Role of Social Reward and Corticostriatal Connectivity in Substance Use. J Psychiatr Brain Sci, 2020. 5. https://doi.org/10.20900/jpbs.20200024

Zaff, O., et al., Social Context and Reward Sensitivity Enhance Corticostriatal Function during Experiences of Shared Rewards. bioRxiv, 2023: p. 2023.10.19.562908. https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.10.19.562908
